poem:
Title: "In Carbon's Silence"

In the scrawl of headlines,
a solemn paleness pervades-
the shrouded skies of tomorrow,
riddled by starving ornaments of change.

Oh, ministers in high towers,
Why sell the sun for shadow's gain?
Carbon, finds no comfort in duration,
but in the suffocation of time.

Can a broken promise mend the air,
or silence the crying wind?
Beware, the heart of nature beats,
in the rhythm of our defeat.
